job_description: Les missions principales liées à la fonction sont les suivantes :Représenter les exigences du client en interne (représentant du client). Définir les objectifs de qualité de l'usine, et surveiller leur progression (représentant de la direction). Gérer le Système de Qualité de l'usine conformément au Système d'excellence de Faurecia. Désigner, gérer le personnel et développer l'organisation du Système de Qualité de l'usine. S'assurer de la conformité de l'usine avec toutes les exigences liées aux réglementations/à la sécurité. Fournir un rapport sur les résultats Qualité à toutes les parties concernées et conserver la documentation et les enregistrements liés à la Qualité Travailler en collaboration avec le département Achats pour toutes les activités et initiatives liées à l'Assurance Qualité des fournisseurs. Interrompre la fabrication ou la livraison de produits en cas de non respect de la Qualité.Compétence RequisesMaîtrise en Ingénierie. Au moins 5 ans d'expérience professionnelle en fabrication, de préférence dans l'industrie automobile Formation IATF Exigée Expérience en relations avec la clientèle

PrésentationDans le cadre du développement de ses activités en Tunisie et à l'international, SCET-TUNISIE recrute Un Technicien Supérieur Routier.MissionLe poste est basé à Tunis.Les dossiers de candidature (CV détaillé + lettre de motivation + photo) sont à envoyer à l’adresse suivante : recrutement@scet-tunisie.com.tnSeuls les candidats dont le dossier aura été retenu seront contactés.ProfilFormation de base ISET exigéeUne expérience d'au moins 5 ans en bureau d'études est requise

MissionVous rejoindrez ODDO BHF Tunis en tant que chargé (e) Conformité pour les activités de la Gestion d’Actifs (« Asset Management »). Ce périmètre couvre les activités pour la France d’intermédiation en assurance (en qualité de courtier), de prestation des services d’investissement et en tant que dépositaire de placements collectifs (gérés dans la plupart du temps pat des sociétés de gestion).La Conformité a pour objectif de prévenir et détecter tout risque de non-conformité aux règlementations bancaires et financières. Le risque de non-conformité est le risque de sanction judiciaire, administrative ou disciplinaire, de perte financière, d’atteinte à la réputation, du fait de l’absence de respect des dispositions réglementaires, des normes et usages professionnels et déontologiques, propres aux activités bancaires et financières.Rattaché à la Responsable Conformité local à Tunis (7 collaborateurs à Tunis), elle-même rattachée à la direction de la conformité en France (9 collaborateurs), vous aurez pour mission principale la Lutte contre le blanchiment d’argent et le financement du terrorisme (LCBFT) et en particulier :1) Contrôle de second niveau LCB-FT (examens renforcées assurance vie)• Analyser les dossiers assurance vie (souscription, versement libre et rachat) en vigilance renforcée soumis par les deux canaux de distribution (CGP/OBP) ;• Orienter le dossier en fonction du risque BC-FT associé à chaque dossier conformément aux procédures de connaissances clients en place tout en adoptant une approche par les risques ;• Valider les dossiers assurance-vie ayant un risque LCB-FT faible ou modéré ;• Préparer les dossiers à risque LCB-FT élevé devant passer en Client Acceptance Commitee (CLAC) ;• Suivre les JIRA COMOASS dès leur création à leur clôture en effectuant les relances si nécessaires ;• Préparer les décisions compliance si nécessaire et les présenter lors d’un point hebdomadaire • Répondre aux demandes des métiers (Pôle Assistants CGP, conseillers commerciaux, banquiers privés et l’équipe Middle-Office) en rapport avec les dossiers ;• Répondre aux demandes des métiers sur des actes spécifiques nécessitant une validation conformité (changement de clause bénéficiaire pour les plus de 85 ans, opérations d’entrée/sortie des fonds sur des contrats mis sous surveillance…).2) Analyse et validation des entrées en relation d’affaires dans l’environnement ODDO SERIVCES• Analyser les dossiers d’entrée en relation d’affaires soumis par l’équipe KYC dans l’environnement ODDO SERVICES ;• Définir le risque LCBFT associé à chaque entrée en relation conformément aux procédures de connaissances clients en place ;• Préparer les dossiers à risque LCBFT élevé devant passer en Client Acceptance Comittee (CLAC)• Suivre les alertes en compte titre dans l’environnement ODDO SERVICES dès leur traitement à leur clôture en effectuant les relances si nécessaire ;• Préparer les décisions compliance si nécessaire et les présenter lors d’un point hebdomadaire avec Safia• Questionner et répondre aux demandes de l’équipe KYC en rapport avec ces dossiers ;3) Traitement des alertes LAT (Lutte Anti-Terrorisme) et Personnes Politiquement Exposées (PPE) sur l’outil SMARAGD• Analyser la pertinence des alertes LAT/PPE sur l’outil SMARAGD ;• Ecarter les alertes non-pertinentes en les justifiant avec un commentaire d’analyse et remonter les alertes pertinentes.4) Dispositif LCB-FT et contrôle de second niveau• Contribuer à la réalisation des contrôles de la cartographie des risques assurance vie et compte titre ;• Contribuer à la réalisation des contrôles LAB spécifiques à la demande ;• Mettre à disposition le taux d’instance en assurance vie (si besoin) et les taux de conformité des alertes LAB.

Yassir is the leading super App in the Maghreb region set to changing the way daily services are provided. It currently operates in 45 cities across Algeria, Morocco and Tunisia with recent expansions into France, Canada and Sub-Saharan Africa. It is backed (:$200M in funding) by VCs from Silicon Valley, Europe and other parts of the world.We offer on-demand services such as ride-hailing and last-mile delivery. Building on this infrastructure, we are now introducing financial services to help our users pay, save and borrow digitally.Helping usher the continent into a digital economy era. We’re not just about serving people - we’re about creating a marketplace to bring people what they need while infusing social values.About The RoleThe role of a Product and Quality Specialist is pivotal in ensuring that the products manufactured and delivered meet the highest standards of quality and align with customer expectations. This multifaceted position combines elements of product development, quality assurance, and continuous improvement to guarantee excellence throughout the product lifecycleAs a recent graduate joining our team, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills in a dynamic and stimulating environmentTASKSCollaborate with cross-functional teams to establish and execute robust quality control procedures. This involves defining quality checkpoints, conducting inspections, and implementing corrective measures to maintain product integrityWork closely with product development teams to embed quality considerations at every stage of the product lifecycle. By integrating quality principles early in the design phase, potential issues can be identified and addressed proactively, ensuring that the final product meets quality standardsPerform various tests and audits throughout the manufacturing process to verify compliance with quality specifications. This includes conducting product inspections, analyzing samples, and utilizing testing equipment to assess product performance and reliabilityAnalyze quality data, including customer feedback and defect reports, to identify trends and areas for improvement. Utilize this information to implement corrective actions and drive continuous improvement initiatives aimed at enhancing product quality and customer satisfactionStay abreast of industry quality standards, regulations, and best practices. Ensure that all products meet regulatory requirements and adhere to relevant quality standards, certifications, and compliance frameworksREQUIREMENTSBachelor's or Master's degree in engineering, computer science, management, or a related fieldStrong analytical skills and attention to detailExcellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teamsA proactive mindset with a commitment to continuous learning and professional developmentPrevious experience or coursework in quality assurance, product development, or manufacturing processes is advantageousAt Yassir, we believe in the power of diversity and the importance of an inclusive culture. So, if you're ready to bring your unique perspective and experiences to the table, then we're excited to listen.Don't just apply for a job, come and be a part of our journey. Let's create a better tomorrow together.We look forward to receiving your application!Best of luck,Your Yassir TA Team

Description De L'entrepriseSopra HR Software, filiale de Sopra Steria, offre des solutions RH complètes parfaitement adaptées aux besoins des Directions des Ressources Humaines et aux organisations de moyennes et grandes tailles, des secteurs public et privé.Spécialiste du pilotage des RH, de la paie et du talent management dans un contexte local et international, Sopra HR accompagne plus de 950 clients, en mode « on-premise » ou mode cloud.Partenaire de la réussite de la transformation digitale de ses clients vers la RH 3.0, Sopra HR, acteur global des Ressources Humaines, privilégie la Co-innovation, favorise les enjeux de performance RH et met en avant l’expérience collaborateur.Description Du PosteNous recherchons un designer expérimenté spécialisé dans la création et le maintien de design systems. En tant que membre clé de notre équipe de design, vous serez responsable de la conception, de la documentation et de la mise à jour d'un design system. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec des designers, des développeurs et des parties prenantes clés pour assurer une cohérence et une évolutivité dans tous nos logiciels.Responsabilités:Concevoir, développer et maintenir le design system de l'entreprise, y compris les composants UI, les lignes directrices visuelles, les règles de typographie et les systèmes de couleurs.Collaborer avec les équipes de développement pour garantir la faisabilité technique des composants et assurer leur intégration harmonieuse dans les produits.Documenter le design system de manière claire et accessible, afin de faciliter son utilisation par toutes les parties prenantes.Travailler avec les designers produit pour garantir la cohérence des expériences utilisateur dans tous les produits.Conduire des recherches et des analyses pour identifier les meilleures pratiques et les tendances émergentes en matière de design system.Fournir des conseils et des formations aux équipes internes sur l'utilisation du design system.Participer aux revues de design et aux séances de rétroaction pour améliorer continuellement le design system.QualificationsCompétences requises:Expérience avérée dans la création et le maintien de design systems pour des produits numériques.Excellente compréhension des principes de design UI/UX.Usage expert de Figma.Solides compétences en communication et capacité à collaborer avec des équipes multidisciplinaires.Capacité à résoudre des problèmes de manière créative et à proposer des solutions innovantes.Attention aux détailsConnaissance des principes d'accessibilité

job_description: The Cloud Operations Machine Learning (COML) team is seeking a Data Science Team Lead to join Infor’s Cloud Operations division. The COML team is responsible for infusing AI and Machine Learning (AI/ML) methodologies into Infor’s cloud operations.  This is a player/coach position with strong emphasis on individual contribution. As the Data Science Team Lead, you will be responsible for putting models and analyses into production on the AWS cloud, overseeing junior data scientists and data engineers, leading projects and initiatives, and providing thought leadership while working on your own analyses, data science and data engineering projects. While day-to-day activities can vary widely, data science engineers are generally responsible for building ETL data pipelines, writing/debugging analytic code, monitoring and maintaining deployed projects, performing analysis on large data sets, translating business problems into mathematical models, presenting findings to varied audiences (internal and external), and taking responsibility for the analytical integrity of our solutions. Infor’s customers depend heavily on our servers operating at peak efficiency and maximum uptime, and any disruption in service can have adverse effects on our customers. Our customers rely on our servers to perform key business operations such as paying their employees, generating essential reports, communicating with their own customers, etc. Therefore, while this is first and foremost a data science position, our goal is improved customer satisfaction and retention. The Cloud Operations division of Infor generates an enormous amount of data for monitoring server uptime and performance, and the COML team uses that data to design and implement innovative AI/ML solutions to complex problems. Our team works on problem solving from beginning to end, from understanding the business problem, prototyping modeling solutions, designing data pipelines, and implementing algorithms in production systems. The COML team is small but growing, and we fulfill a specialized role within Infor. We have a shared goal: to apply our extensive training and passion for problem solving to solve challenging real-world problems. This is not an academic position; it is a data engineering and applied science engineering position; we want to see our algorithm designs in production. We are always learning about new applications and opportunities to apply our talents, and scientists are free to use whatever mathematical approaches make the most sense for the problem at hand. A Day In The Life Typically Includes 	* Working in AWS to implement and deploy data pipelines and data science models 	* Perform code reviews 	* Optimizing SQL queries for performance 	* Maintain and debug data science models already in production 	* Meet with stakeholders to fully understand business problems and how to solve those problems. 	* Meet with members of your team to align goals and monitor progress. 	* Drive cross-team coordination to ensure that roles and responsibilities are clear and project timelines are met. 	* Define data requirements and perform exploratory data analysis. 	* Design and test different AI/ML models and algorithms. 	* Prototype and optimize different AI/ML models to identify the optimal modeling approach for any given data problem.	* Translate business problems to mathematical models and validate understanding with stakeholders.	Basic Qualifications What You Will Need: 	* Four-year degree in one of the following (or related) fields: Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field. 	* Proven experience in an engineering focused data science position, or a data engineering position with a heavy analytics data science/emphasis. 	* Strong, real word experience in python (other high-level languages like Java, Go, etc. acceptable) 	* Basic SQL 	* Able to work both independently and as part of a team. 	* A desire to continue learning new technologies and techniques. 	* Experience analyzing time series data. 	* Experience in a leadership capacity, either formal or informal.	Required Qualifications 	* Advanced proficiency in python. 	* Advanced proficiency in SQL 	* Demonstrated experience in engineering solutions in the cloud (ideally AWS) 	* Experience with Git and Docker 	* Understanding of the AWS ecosystem and how to integrate technologies together such as Athena, Lambda, S3 etc. 	* Demonstrated real-world experience in designing and implementing a full data science production pipeline, from ETL, to data pre-processing, to model prototyping, to model deployment and inference. 	* Ability to develop complex algorithms when necessary and simple algorithms when possible. 	* Strong knowledge of mathematics/data analysis and statistics 	* Familiarity with advanced AI/ML techniques such as boosted models and tree-based models etc. 	* Excellent communication skills (eg. the ability to communicate effectively and efficiently with a broad range of audiences.)About InforInfor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation. For more information visit www.infor.comOur ValuesAt Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called [1] Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the infor.com/about/careers webpage.At Infor we value your privacy that’s why we created a policy that you can read [2] here.ReferencesVisible links1. https://www.kochind.com/about/business-philosophy2. https://www.infor.com/about/privacy

Forvis Mazars est un réseau mondial de référence de services professionnels, qui opère sous une marque unique et compte deux membres seulement : Forvis Mazars, LLP aux Etats-Unis, et Forvis Mazars Group SC, un partnership international intégré opérant dans plus de 100 pays et territoires. Les deux membres partagent le même engagement : offrir une expérience client inégalée, en fournissant des services d’audit, de fiscalité et de conseil partout dans le monde.Rejoindre Forvis Mazars c’est prendre part à une aventure unique, qui vous accompagne, vous forme et vous offre des possibilités de carrière à votre image en Tunisie et à l’international.Nous recrutons, dans le cadre du développement de nos équipes, un manager Audit pour le secteur industriel.Notre poste :Vous intégrez une équipe opérationnelle et interviendrez sur des missions d’audit et de commissariat aux comptes pour une clientèle du secteur industriel.Vos principales missions :La planification de la mission ;La prise en charge des différents cycles d’audit ;L’appréciation du dispositif de contrôle interne ;L’élaboration de la note de synthèse ;La gestion de la relation avec les équipes et les clients.Vos atouts :Vous êtes diplômé(e) du Certificat d’Etudes Supérieures en Révision Comptable ou du Diplôme Supérieur de Comptabilité et de Gestion ou du Master CCA ou du Master en Révision Comptable ;Vous justifiez d’une expérience de 7 ans minimum en audit, idéalement dans le secteur industriel ;Vous maîtrisez les techniques d’audit et les normes comptables ;Vous êtes doté(e) d’une bonne capacité d’analyse et de synthèse ;Vous avez de bonnes capacités à manager des équipes ;Vous maitrisez parfaitement le français et l’anglais.

Planning ManagerLieu : MegrineÀ propos du poste Prêt·e à repousser les limites du possible ? Rejoignez Sanofi à l’un de nos postes fonctionnels pour jouer un rôle essentiel dans la performance de l'ensemble de nos activités tout en contribuant à améliorer la vie de millions de personnes dans le monde. En tant que Planning Manager au sein de notre équipe planning , vous contribuerez à Établir et maintenir des processus, des politiques et des normes pour la gestion des projets au sein de l'organisation.Description d'emploi :Planification et Ordonnancement : Gestion et optimisation des données techniques au niveau système d'information Assurer l'administration des systèmes logistiques au niveau planification Lancer et analyser le PDP Lancer et analyser MRP Mise en place et gestion du planning d'approvisionnement Optimisation des outils de planification et de gestion des stocks Suivre le flux Interco Elaboration du planning de libération MPAC Elaboration et suivi du planning mensuel de production Lancement des ordres processApprovisionnement : Gestion des processus d'approvisionnement : Matières premières & Articles deconditionnement Gestion et optimisation des données approvisionnement avec une amélioration du serviced'Approvisionnement Coordination avec le Prestataire pour les besoins des activités de transit et de transport Coordination avec la DAF avec suivi des règlements, litiges et réclamations Optimisation du plan d'approvisionnement avec un pilotage régulier du processusD'approvisionnement Participation et animation du +QDCI et de l'Obeya Room Approvisionnement Implication dans l'analyse de la valeur de stock avec le recalcul et l'ajustement de besoins Gestion d'un tableau de bord fournisseurs et leurs évaluations Coordination et assurance des différents services intervenants dans le processusd'approvisionnement (Autorités réglementaires, Prestataire pour les activités de transit etde transport, banques et services internes : Qualité, comptabilité, finances, etc...) Gestion des commandes : Validation des DA sur CEP avec leurs conversions, en assurantLes délais de livrassions Participation et Implication dans les projets par anticipation et respect des deadlines Coordination et participation lors des audits fournisseurs pour le respect des cahiers deFrais. Gestion des CAPA et la Coordination Fournisseurs / Assurance Qualité pour la gestion desRéclamations en cas de litige.Responsabilité HSE :Tous les niveaux de management démontrent leur engagement visible pour HSE et ont la responsabilité particulière de donner l'exemple (modèle). Ils démontrent une culture forte et proactive orientée vers la promotion de comportements positifs à tous les niveaux de l'organisation (animation des programmes et outils HSE : tel que HSE8, signaux faibles, Zéro Access, etc.). Les managers sont responsables de la réalisation du cursus d'habilitation HSE des employés, veillent à ce que les risques soient correctement évalués et maîtrisés, initient et participent aux enquêtes sur les accidents dans leur domaine de responsabilité. Assurer avec l'équipe du respect des standards HSE Groupe. Communiquer les diagnostics et les plans d'actions avec les différents métiers. Participer aux différents chantiers d'amélioration des performances de l'activité.Responsabilité HSE : Respecter les règles qui sauvent la vie Sanofi LSR et les exigences HSE liées à ses activités. Chaque employé est habilité à identifier, corriger et signaler rapidement des conditionsdangereuses, des comportements à risques ou des situations potentiellementdangereuses. Porter les tenues, chaussures de sécurité et les EPI mis à disposition. Veiller au bon maintien des EPI mis à disposition et assurer leur conservation selon lesconsignes en vigueur. Remonter les signaux faibles et toute situation à risque via l'élément HSE8 lors de la réunion +QDCI. Faire les formations HSE à temps. Faire l'examen médical suite à l'appel du médecin de travail. Ne pas utiliser des équipements électriques présentant des défauts (fils dénudés, partie manquante, multiprise non vérifiée etc.) Respecter scrupuleusement les consignes HSE dans les zones à risque (ATEX, CMR, zone de déchargement magasin, zone confinée, toit non porteur, etc.) Respecter scrupuleusement les consignes HSE en vigueur lors d'un travail en hauteur > 1,8m. Editer les évents HSE à temps pour lancer les investigations suite à un incident et/ou situation à risque. Editer les changes control à temps pour tout changement. Veiller au respect des procédures en vigueur de gestion des déchets et des effluents. Assurer la remontée des écarts Housekeeping via les bons de travaux. Ne pas shunter les dispositifs de sécurité. Ne pas jeter dans l'évier les déchets des produits chimiques et/ou pharmaceutiques. Respecter les consignes HSE lors de la conduite des engins de manutention, si applicable. Fumer uniquement dans les zones dédiées. Maintenir le poste de travail propre et éviter de jeter les déchets hors les zones dédiées.À propos de vous  Expérience : 5 ans et plus dans le meme posteCompétences générales et techniques : Formation : Ingénierie Langues : Francais/ Anglais Toujours progresser. Découvrir l’extraordinaire.Le progrès ne se fait pas tout seul, ce sont les gens qui le construisent : des gens d'horizons différents, dans des lieux différents, dans des rôles différents, mais tous réunis par une même motivation : la volonté de rendre l’impossible possible. Et si vous rejoigniez cet élan ? Afin de poursuivre le changement, adopter de nouvelles idées et explorer toutes les opportunités que nous avons à offrir. Ensemble, continuons de progresser. Et partons à la découverte de l'extraordinaire.Chez Sanofi, nous croyons en l’égalité des chances pour tout le monde, indépendamment de l’origine, de la couleur de peau, des croyances, du genre, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'âge, de la citoyenneté, de l'état civil, du handicap ou de l’identité de genre.Regardez notre vidéo ALL IN et consultez nos actions en faveur de la diversité, de l'équité et de l'inclusion sur sanofi.com !Pursue progress, discover extraordinaryBetter is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, ability or gender identity.Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!
industry: Chemical Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing

job_description: Background/Summary about the company:Through our company, our departments and our employees, we have a single vision through which we seek to raise the efficiency of work and development, reduce waste and pollution, rationalize spending and maintain comprehensive quality standards. Choosing us means that you will get a unique and unparalleled experience according to the highest standards of quality and integrity it guarantees you a safe trade with inspection programs that help you monitor your supplies, and help you develop your product, double your profits, and protect your trade currencies. Through our team, we follow up on your business and monitor it anytime and anywhere. It is done in accordance with the contractual terms and inspection conditions stipulated in international standards ISO-IEC: 17020/2012.Job Function:Quality assurance of the Products.Duties and Responsibilities:Assure that the products are not contaminated and that sanitation procedures are maintained, so products can meet the safety requirements of the destination market.Examining products at ports, making sure the products are correctly labeled and that the explanatory data on the packages and packaging materials conform to the terms of the contract.Make sure that products are up to date and reject any expired products by informing the direct manager.Ensure all processed products comply with provided standards.Random samples are implemented and making sure that it is compatible with the phenomenon of the contract conditions.Verify the laboratory in which some virtual and initial tests will be conducted and emphasize that samples are correctly preserved according to the nature of the material in the condition.Provide the final evaluation of the shipment based on the results of analysis received from one of the laboratories approved by the company's work system.Report and send all the shipment documents directly to the Technical Operation manager on the performance of the Food Safety Management System.Check the quantity and quality of the product before shipment depending on standard specification.Pre-shipment inspection is mandatory. Check the ship’s documents are vialed to meet class certifications and B&I certifications.Check packages to verify that the correct packing materials are being used to ensure safe transportation, and that correct packaging labels are applied.Skills and CompetenciesCritical Thinking - Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.Judgment and Decision Making - Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.Time Management - Managing one's own time and the time of others.Strong observation of details, orator and strong literacy skills.Ability to prepare and maintain correspondence, reports and inspection records.Work environment:Flexibility in schedule (Part-time).QualificationPreferred a Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree.4 years of experience as drug inspector or marine surveyor or cargo inspector.Excellent in spoken and written English.If you are interested, please send your CV in English to the following Email address:hr@almutamadoon.comVisit us on: www.almutamadoon.com.

job_title: Consultant Ingénieur Maintenance Automatismes Pharmaceutique H/F
job_description: Chez Anywr.Life - nous sommes spécialisés dans les life sciences, et nous nous occupons de votre projet de mobilité de A à Z, qu’il soit en France ou à l’international. Nos spécialistes du secteur life sciences sont à votre écoute pour vous accompagner :Trouver votre futur poste ? Changer de région ? Dénicher votre futur logement ? Inscrire vos enfants à l'école ? Dire adieu aux tracas administratifs ? C'est facile avec ANYWR, nous sommes experts de ces sujets !Nous recrutons aujourd’hui en CDI des profils Ingénieur Maintenance spécialisés dans le secteur de l'industrie pharmaceutique, afin de rejoindre notre équipe Consulting Life Sciences en France dans le cadre d'un projet d'expatriation.Vos Missions:Votre mission principale sera d’apporter des solutions techniques et de gestion pour nos clients dans l'industrie pharmaceutique afin d’améliorer la performance et la qualité de leur environnement.Vous interviendrez directement sur le site de nos partenaires en environnement BPF pour travailler en mode projet.Votre rôle de Consultant(e) Ingénieur Maintenance Process et Utilités sera de contribuer aux projets de nos clients tels que :Assurer la maintenance préventive des équipements selon le planning établiRéaliser des investigations de recherches de pannesRéaliser les interventions de dépannage des équipements à l'aide de plan et schéma,Piloter l’optimisation des plans de maintenance et des outils de gestion de maintenance (GMAO assisté par ordinateur…)Optimiser la maintenance préventive et curative sur le site client et mettre en place une démarche prédictive si nécessaireMettre en place des indicateurs de suivi et d’optimisation et les piloter (TRS…)Participer à la mise en place des nouveaux équipements (travaux neufs bâtiments et extensions)Profil:Vous êtes issu(e) d'une formation Ingénieur ou BAC+5 spécialisé en Méthodes MaintenanceVous avez 5 ans d'expérience et plus en maintenance d'équipements de production, process et utilités dans le secteur pharmaceutiqueMaitrise des outils de fiabilisation, GMAO et des méthodes d'amélioration continue, FAT/SATConnaissances en mécanique, électrotechnique, automatismes voir hydraulique et pneumatiqueExpérience en pilotage de budgetVos qualités relationnelles vous permettent de travailler en équipe avec l'ensemble de vos interlocuteurs, tout en étant autonome dans votre activitéAnglais opérationnel à l'écrit et à l'oralVotre parcours professionnel est orienté dans le domaine pharmaceutique et vous réfléchissez à un projet d'expatriation en France ?Déposez votre candidature chez ANYWR et nous discuterons ensemble de votre projet et de notre accompagnement !
industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing

job_description: Company DescriptionDevoteam has been an international leader in consulting in digital strategy, technology platforms, cybersecurity and digital business transformation for 25 years.With more than 10,000 employees around the world, we imagine and realize their ambitions thanks to the infinite possibilities given by digital platforms, shaping a new culture and way of working.We are present in 18 countries, putting "Technology at the service of Man" in order to build a more sustainable world.Devoteam Tunisie, a subsidiary of Devoteam Group, has been generating value for over 12 years. Working on both the African and international scales, our team consists of over 100 multidisciplinary consultants (consultants in digital transformation, developers, project managers, data and cyber security experts) working on enriching and innovative projects.Working at Devoteam encompasses:Appreciating our partners' expertise in technologies such as Google, Microsoft, AWS, ServiceNow, and Salesforce, which we use to implement solutions for our clients.Evolving within an international organization that supports your career development with tailored training and certification programs.Joining a specialized team, accompanied(ed) by a local manager who will advise you in your decisions and encourage interactions with your pairings.Growing in a company that challenges its teams by being nimble and ambitious, adapting to individual and collective success.  Job Description• Lead the transition of our infrastructure from Azure to AKS.• Develop and maintain backend services using C#.• Work with frontend technologies, primarily Angular, to create responsive and user-friendly interfaces.• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.• Utilize Azure DevOps for CI/CD pipelines and project management.• Apply Docker knowledge for containerization and deployment within AKS.• Write clean, scalable code and conduct regular code reviews.• Take ownership of features from inception to deployment, ensuring they meet business and technical requirements.• Act as a quick learner, adapting to new technologies and methodologies as needed.   Qualifications• Proven experience in full stack development with a strong focus on both frontend and backend technologies.• Proficiency in C# for backend development.• Experience with Angular or similar frontend frameworks.• Strong knowledge of containerization tools, specifically Docker.• Hands-on experience with Azure DevOps for CI/CD and project management.• Familiarity with Python is a plus.• Demonstrated ability to take responsibility for a feature's full lifecycle, from planning to deployment.                                                                                                                                • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to learn quickly.• Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.    • Excellent level of English (Written and spoken)

Yassir is the leading super App in the Maghreb region set to changing the way daily services are provided. It currently operates in 45 cities across Algeria, Morocco and Tunisia with recent expansions into France, Canada and Sub-Saharan Africa. It is backed (:$200M in funding) by VCs from Silicon Valley, Europe and other parts of the world.We offer on-demand services such as ride-hailing and last-mile delivery. Building on this infrastructure, we are now introducing financial services to help our users pay, save and borrow digitally.Helping usher the continent into a digital economy era. We’re not just about serving people - we’re about creating a marketplace to bring people what they need while infusing social values.About The RoleThe role of a Product and Quality Specialist is pivotal in ensuring that the products manufactured and delivered meet the highest standards of quality and align with customer expectations. This multifaceted position combines elements of product development, quality assurance, and continuous improvement to guarantee excellence throughout the product lifecycleAs a recent graduate joining our team, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills in a dynamic and stimulating environmentTASKSCollaborate with cross-functional teams to establish and execute robust quality control procedures. This involves defining quality checkpoints, conducting inspections, and implementing corrective measures to maintain product integrityWork closely with product development teams to embed quality considerations at every stage of the product lifecycle. By integrating quality principles early in the design phase, potential issues can be identified and addressed proactively, ensuring that the final product meets quality standardsPerform various tests and audits throughout the manufacturing process to verify compliance with quality specifications. This includes conducting product inspections, analyzing samples, and utilizing testing equipment to assess product performance and reliabilityAnalyze quality data, including customer feedback and defect reports, to identify trends and areas for improvement. Utilize this information to implement corrective actions and drive continuous improvement initiatives aimed at enhancing product quality and customer satisfactionStay abreast of industry quality standards, regulations, and best practices. Ensure that all products meet regulatory requirements and adhere to relevant quality standards, certifications, and compliance frameworksREQUIREMENTSBachelor's or Master's degree in engineering, computer science, management, or a related fieldStrong analytical skills and attention to detailExcellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teamsA proactive mindset with a commitment to continuous learning and professional developmentPrevious experience or coursework in quality assurance, product development, or manufacturing processes is advantageousAt Yassir, we believe in the power of diversity and the importance of an inclusive culture. So, if you're ready to bring your unique perspective and experiences to the table, then we're excited to listen.Don't just apply for a job, come and be a part of our journey. Let's create a better tomorrow together.We look forward to receiving your application!Best of luck,Your Yassir TA Team

The Functional Consultant position is an integral part of the Infor Global Delivery Services (GDS) organization, which deliver customizations, systems analysis, training, and client support for Infor M3 customers around the world. We are subject matter experts of our Infor M3 product suite, capitalizing on our industry knowledge to efficiently provide our customers solutions to enhance their business processes. Whilst our technology is the enabler and vehicle for achieving business benefits, the quality and experience of our consultants are key differentiators.	Infor is looking for motivated, creative and enthusiastic (Senior) Business Consultants with in-depth knowledge in one of more of the following industries: Manufacturing, Distribution, Food and Beverage and/or Fashion. 	You will be responsible for delivering business process and application consulting services which include process design, application configuration, testing, client training on Infor software, technologies and tools in accordance with standard implementation methods. Developing ongoing, successful business relationships with clients and for providing clients with "industry best practice" recommendations is also an important part of your role.	Key Responsibilities	* Provide consultative guidance and assistance in a professional and organized manner directly to customers within the ERP M3  area.	* Develop functional/technical solution & configuration that matches client requirements and design specifications	* Participate in full life cycle client facing implementation projects, including information gathering, analysis, design, implementation, testing and go live processes relating to Infor M3 application	* Work within project teams to develop functional/technical solution & configuration that matches client requirements and design specifications	* Establish, execute and monitor implementation plan within Infor M3 suite or technology	* Add value to customer projects by using the know-how about Infor solutions and implementations derived from practical experiences.	* Provide customers with integration and industry expertise as well as "best practice" recommendations; act as an advisor to Infor customers regarding best practices and how to configure their Infor solution for making their processes and way of working more efficient.	* Provide in depth application and business consultation in targeted processes.	* Design and configure efficient client business solutions.	* Develop and execute test plans.	* Perform testing of software configurations and customer solutions.	* Provide training to client’s key and end users.	* Achieving engagement objectives.	* Provide regular internal project reports when required.	* Be a team player, form a relationship with the customer at all levels and also be able to drive a problem through to resolution	Basic Qualifications	* Consulting experience 	* Full lifecycle Implementation experience using M3 or equivalent software is highly desired	* Prior ERP implementation and/or configuration experience in Sales, Manufacturing, Logistics OR Finance and at least in one industry segment: Manufacturing, Distribution, Food and Beverage, Fashion	* For the Finance Consultant, he/she will need to have an in depth understanding of Finance business processes including GL, AR, AP, Fixed Assets and/or costing	* Excellent data and information researching skills and be enthusiastic about contributing to team projects.	* Well-developed IT skills	* Experience in a project orientated environment	* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent. This position requires a degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Informatics, Supply Chain Management, and/or Finance. 	* Fluent written and spoken French and English is mandatory	* Good interpersonal skills for internal and external communication.	* Willingness to travelAbout InforInfor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation. For more information visit www.infor.comOur ValuesAt Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called [1] Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the infor.com/about/careers webpage.At Infor we value your privacy that’s why we created a policy that you can read [2] here.ReferencesVisible links1. https://www.kochind.com/about/business-philosophy2. https://www.infor.com/about/privacy

Yassir is the leading super App in the Maghreb region set to changing the way daily services are provided. It currently operates in 45 cities across Algeria, Morocco and Tunisia with recent expansions into France, Canada and Sub-Saharan Africa. It is backed (:$200M in funding) by VCs from Silicon Valley, Europe and other parts of the world.We offer on-demand services such as ride-hailing and last-mile delivery. Building on this infrastructure, we are now introducing financial services to help our users pay, save and borrow digitally.Helping usher the continent into a digital economy era. We’re not just about serving people - we’re about creating a marketplace to bring people what they need while infusing social values.As a product data analyst at Yassir, working in the Data and AI team, you will have the opportunity to do life-changing work for Yassir’s millions of customers. You will apply groundbreaking analytics that will shape the super-app strategy of Yassir and support the growth and success of all the services Yassir is currently offering across 45 cities in 7 countries.ResponsibilitiesYou will work on different products, including ML/AI products, front-end products and backend systems, and will apply your data analysis skills, your analytical thinking and product intuition to create a marketplace of on-demand services. You will work cross-functionally with partners across Product, Engineering, Research, Marketing, etc. to identify and solve the most important business and product problems for Yassir. You are a data ambassador and foster a data-driven product development culture. Product: You will influence product strategy and execution. You will use data to shape product development, quantify new opportunities, identify upcoming challenges, and ensure the products we build bring value to all parties in our marketplace. You will help your partner teams prioritize what to build, set goals, track progress and understand their product’s ecosystem. Analytics: You will work with Engineering on collecting the right data to enable data driven decisions at Yassir. You will guide teams using data and insights. You will focus on developing hypotheses for where product opportunities are and will develop and use a diverse toolkit of rigorous analytical approaches, different methodologies, frameworks, and technical approaches to test them, building a continuous test-and-learn environment. Communication and influence: You will tell data-driven stories. You will influence your partners using insights and recommendations and move your organization to being truly and solely data-driven. REQUIREMENTSBachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, a relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. A minimum experience of 5 years in analytics in a business or product environment. Experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), and/or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R)BENEFITSGreat compensation and bonuses including stock options.Blue sky opportunity with the team; shape the strategic direction of the companySharp, motivated co-workers in a fun hybrid environmentPaid company holidaysWHY YOU SHOULD JOIN YASSIRJoin one of the fastest-growing tech companies in AfricaHave a lasting impact on our company's cultureMake a real impact on the world by helping us bring affordable financial and on-demand services to millions of AfricansWork on some really hard technical challenges from identity infrastructure for Africans, digital payment networks to complex mapping and routing systems across the continentWe are the first Algerian startup to go through Y Combinator program and we’re backed by top investors including Unpopular Ventures, Rebel Fund and DainTree.VCAt Yassir, we believe in the power of diversity and the importance of an inclusive culture. So, if you're ready to bring your unique perspective and experiences to the table, then we're excited to listen.Don't just apply for a job, come and be a part of our journey. Let's create a better tomorrow together.We look forward to receiving your application!Best of luck,Your Yassir TA Team

Au sein de By4 Intermediation & Management, notre quête incessante d'innovation dans le domaine de la rénovation énergétique nous incite à envisager de nouveaux horizons. En qualité d'ingénieur électrique, vous aurez pour mission de canaliser votre expertise technique afin de contribuer à notre expansion vers des marchés émergents, tout en participant activement à la réalisation de projets d'avant-garde. Rejoignez notre équipe dynamique, où l'excellence est notre mot d'ordre, et ensemble, écrivons les prochains chapitres d'une success story teintée d'ingéniosité et de durabilité.Responsabilités :- Participer à la conceptualisation et à l'implémentation de solutions électriques novatrices, en utilisant une approche analytique et créative.- Collaborer étroitement avec nos équipes pluridisciplinaires pour intégrer harmonieusement les aspects électriques dans l'ensemble de nos projets, tout en étant capable de traduire les données en actions concrètes sur le terrain.- Assurer la conformité aux normes de qualité ainsi que le respect des délais impartis pour chacun de nos projets.Exigences :- Titulaire d'un diplôme d'ingénieur en génie électrique ou domaine équivalent.- Une ardente passion pour la rénovation énergétique, accompagnée d'une volonté inébranlable de contribuer à des initiatives durables.- Une expérience préalable dans la conception et l’exécution de systèmes électriques couplée à une maitrise de la modélisation BIM est vivement souhaitée.- Capacité démontrée à imaginer et à trouver des solutions à la fois sur le terrain et à travers l'analyse de données.- Doté d'une aisance à travailler aussi en équipe ainsi qu’une maîtrise complète des logiciels du métiers (Dialux, Autocad, Matlab, Revit MEP...) permettant une complète autonomie.- Des compétences remarquables en communication et en résolution de problèmes sont essentielles pour exceller dans ce rôle stimulant.

Context Using proven top-notch technologies, Vneuron Risk & Compliance creates world class softwares helping financial institutions reach full AML (Anti-Money Laundering) Compliance and Combat Terrorist Financing (CTF). The estimated amount of money laundered globally in one year is between 2 to 5% of global GDP, equivalent to $800 billion - $2 trillion US dollars. This huge amount of illicit funds are coming from corruption, drug dealing, child labor, organ trade and so forth. Our purpose is to fight financial crime through technology in order to ensure global business growth, international security and to help change the world for the better.We are trusted by more than hundreds financial institutions worldwide from more than 45 countries in Europe, Africa, USA and the Middle East. We also have affiliates in France, Cameroon, Kenya and Qatar. Experts in the field of Compliance, have listed us in Deloitte Regtech Universe and we have been recognized as one of the top 100 innovative regtech solutions for the year 2022. Most recently, our solution Reis RCS has been ranked in Chartis Research Quadrant 2022 among the best point solutions in the Trade-Based Anti-Money Laundering worldwide.Our Spark solution Reis RCS ensures the automation of AML compliance processes :Real time transactions filtering, Transaction monitoring using Machine Learning techniques, KYC. We are applying daily name screening on about 27 millions profiles and more than 15 000 users are using our solutions on a daily basis.Culture & ValuesVneuron puts the development of its team at the heart of its priorities. We provide a pleasant and comfortable work environment. Our organization structure is collaborative and flat structured. And, our management is available and present. We believe that every person is unique and special. Thus, we provide an attentive and active listening to your ideas and propositions as we believe that you will have an essential role in achieving our next milestone and shaping Vneurons future.Moreover, you will be surrounded by highly skilled technical and functional experts willing to help you evolve in all aspects of your career. We have a passionate and committed young team who values respect and sharing spirit. You will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects that are generating a positive impact around the world. As we are committed to continuous growth and ambitious about bigger achievements, we never stop learning.RequirementsHaving an engineering diploma with solid understanding of software developmentHaving a relevant experience as a Project Manager or Product Owner or Scrum master in an IT context ideallyProactive with good interpersonal and communication skillsAnalytical and problem solving skillsGood team player and effective leaderProven time management and adaptability skillsNice to havePMP-PMI certification Scrum Master certification Knowledge in ISO 9001 and CMMiMissionsDevelop project milestones and work streamsLead and coordinate between multi-disciplinary teamsSet up an agile environmentUnderstand customer's needs and propose optimal solutions considering possible constraints.Estimate budget, resources and time needed to fulfill project goals while identifying and managing project risksParticipate in POC realizationFollow up project progress and provide regular reportsControl and monitor projects KPIsEnsure project delivering and customer satisfactionBenefitsThe opportunity to work on exciting projects that are generating a positive impact around the world.Career Growth opportunityHealthcare and wellness Benefits to you and your familyAn evolving and pleasant environment where diversity is applauded, and success is celebrated.Appropriate conditions to help you focus on what you love doingA winning team that has relied on Respect, Sharing and Passion for what it doesEqual Employment Opportunities : Gender, religious, culture equityPossibility to work remotelyNext stepsIf you have the ambition to stimulate your career with new challenges while capitalizing on your potential and your perpetual thirst for learning, this job is for you.Apply Now and become the next Spark !Follow us on LinkedIn to know more about the Spark team and our spark solutions.We would be very happy to meet you and give you much more information!

job_title: People Business Partner, M&S site Megrine, CHC
job_description: Job title : People Business Partner, Manufacturing and Supply site Megrine, CHCLocation: MegrineSanofi CHC: At Sanofi Consumer Healthcare, we're building healthier future by helping people help themselves. We empower people to champion better self-care for themselves, our communities and our planet by making it as simple as it should be. We are a brand led, consumer first organization focused on growing our leading loved brands like Buscopan®, Nospa®, Eneterogermina®, Allegra®, Dulco®, or Essentiale® to help more people play an active role in their health.Working together, we're focused on simplifying our business, clarifying roles and responsibilities and driving personal accountability to improve collaboration and excellence of execution while role-modeling and fostering challenger mindset across the whole organization to enable everyone to bring out their best every day.About the job :Ready to push the limits of what’s possible? Join Sanofi in one of our corporate functions and you can play a vital part in the performance of our entire business while helping to make an impact on millions around the world. As People Business Partner within our People Business Partnering team, you’ll help in understanding of and expertise in how the HR function makes a line of business within the company successful.Job Purpose:As the People Business Partner this role is key in delivering our People Priorities at the Site.To achieve success, it is critical that the People Business Partner is able to demonstrate the following capabilities: Business Partnering Leading activities as Strategic Workforce Planning, Recruitment, Training and Development, Performance Management, Compensation Review, Career and Succession planning / mapping for critical roles, Leadership DevelopmentCoaching people managers on people management skill and leadership in their organizations.Re-directing client groups to appropriate sources for query resolutionResponsible for employee relations & employer brandingDriving employee engagementLeading change management activities.Workforce planning & Personnel budget planning for the whole population of the CHC population at the Megrine Site.Front to end Employee Services & process governance and implementation.Talent management & performance management: Compensation and benefitsEmployees relations, Labor Union partnership & External AffairsPartner with business leader in all employee relations subjects, culture and partnership with the Labor Unions & their authorities.Be the main contact points for all external industrial affairsKey Results / AccountabilitiesPartner with IA and provide all HR operations & services at plants Manage front to end services and processes from hiring, training, compensation and benefits till termination or retirement process. Responsibility for headcount planning, budget planning, organization management, reports and analytics, system management, third party inspection/audits related to CNSS. Partner with IA to develop HR solutions that transform our business and deliver the growth by working with relevant COE to seek out relevant interventions to address HR matters in procedures of recruitment, performance management, training & development, compensation & benefits, career path development. Ensure compliance for all HR processes & policies effectively in IA and maintain HR data with integrity & accuracy. Facilitate and coordinate all departments in IA to manage performance and build high performing culture. Lead and provide consultation to business leader on trust culture building and help business to improve relationship with employees and Labor Unions; build direct connection channels between management team and employees to enhance employee satisfaction and engagement. Lead career development programs and ownership, development programs, succession planning for key positions in IA. Lead and run all HR projects to improve high performing culture, conduct behavior and mindset change programs for IA people, prepare for IA to get more ready for the CHC Transformation Journey. Partner with IA stakeholders to facilitate organization design and organization development. Manage different stake holders internally and externally including the SITE Head, Labor Unions, Labor Union Authority departments and other external industrial stakeholders.People Leadership Where applicable performance manages the team through setting and reviewing priorities, provide timely feedback about performance and coaches team members to help them achieve their goalsSupports the professional and career development of the team by identifying the skills and competencies that employees need for their current and prospective roles and provide opportunities to learn and practice new skillsLeads the building of a motivated and engaged team through the use of formal and informal recognition, regular communications and the encouragement of cooperation between individuals and teamsMaintain Compliance Abide by the requirements of the internal Code of Ethics including but not restricted to maintaining high professional standards of conduct in line with the Company procedure with a duty of care to the reputation of the Company Ethical LeadershipTakes personal accountability to use personal experience and knowledge, as well as the training and tools provided by Sanofi, to maintain a good knowledge and understanding of all ethics and governance relevant to the role (Sanofi Policies and Procedures and any relevant legal requirements) and demonstrate personal leadership in applying these to all work undertaken.Escalates any decisions, or seek the support of colleagues or management if personal knowledge and understanding is not at the level required to carry out any part of the roleEnvironmental and Safety Leadership To care for his/her own safety and wellbeing and the safety of others, and to co-operate with the company to ensure a safe place of work.Employees are therefore expected to:Support and conform to Company safety rules and procedures to ensure a safe and healthy working environmentReport any accident, incident or near miss, whether it be of personal injury or property damageAssist in the investigation of accidents with the objective of introducing measures to prevent recurrenceThoroughly read all safety documentation issues by the Company and comply with its requirements. Escalate any doubts or uncertainties to their supervisor and / or manager.KEY WORKING RELATIONSHIPSINTERNALCross Functional Collaboration with:All functions at the siteCOE’sFinanceEXTERNAL Would be expected to be involved with:UnionsLabour InspectorateSkills, Experience & Knowledge RequirementsEducation Level: minimum Bachelor’s in Human Resource Management / CIPDExperience: min 5 years in a similar roleIA experience is a plusArabic & French Fluency is a pre requisiteEnglish well spokenSkills:Strong Communication and negotiation skills especially in discussions with external stakeholders / UnionsSelf-motivated individual who would be a Change Agent at the SiteBusiness and financial acumenBudget Planning / Analytical skillsMust demonstrate the Play to Win Behaviours Stretch – We Differentiate where it countsTake Action – We drive ResultsFeedback – We challenge each other to growTogetherness – We enjoy the ride togetherWhat we offer at Sanofi:an international work environment, in which you can develop your talent and realize ideas and innovations within a competent team;access to internal recruitment and development libraries - you can create your own career path within Sanofi; your professional development will be supported purposefully;flexible home office policy, with a possibility to work up to 50% of time from home, where you can easily schedule your office daysan attractive package of benefitsEmployee Assistance Program (mental health support, legal and financial consulting)Gender neutral paid parental leave as well as volunteer daysIf the description fits your experience and has aroused your interest, please apply so we can get in contact with you! job_description: Mazars is a leading international audit, tax and advisory firm. Operating as a united partnership, we work as one integrated team, leveraging expertise, scale and cultural understanding to deliver exceptional and tailored services in audit and accounting, as well as tax, financial advisory, and consulting.We have grown into a global, connected partnership of over 47,000 professionals, with a presence in over 95 countries and territories.We are looking for several junior acceptance officers to support our teams in the Client Acceptance Process. You will be involved in the full process including AML and independence aspects, and will have the opportunity to learn about other compliance aspects.Responsibilities:Your role within our teams is mainly to:Get a thorough understanding of the AML (Anti-Money Laundering) rules applicable in Luxembourg and a broad understanding of the other rules applicable to audit firms (Independence, Ethics, Quality and Secrecy);Assist in the analysis of KYC (Know Your Client) information for new and existing clients;Get a proper understanding of clients’ structure and risks, and challenge the information collected, including towards name screening;Document KYC files in cooperation with business lines;Verify the correctness of information into our CRM system Junior Acceptance Officerand update information as required;Assist in the verification of independence rules applicable to our business;Participate in compliance monitoring programs;Assist in any other Compliance matter.You will interact daily with the Compliance and Operational teams.Your profile:You hold a Master’s degree oriented in law, business, audit or economics;You have at least one year of experience in a corporate, compliance or legal department, or similar function;Prior knowledge of AML/CTF rules is a plus; You demonstrate strong attention to details excellent analytical skills;You are able to work autonomously but you enjoy working in a team. You have good communication skills;You are able to work on multiple projects at the same time, prioritize tasks and respect deadlines;You respect strict confidentiality;You are fluent in French and English (oral and written).You are self-motivated, proactive, have a positive attitude and you are willing to learn.

Elastic, Redis, RabbitMQProficiency in languages: C/C++, C#, Java, Go, PythonResponsibilities:Back-end development of new modules part of a travel cloud ecosystem.Write and maintain high-quality job_description: Want to join a frontrunner in renewable energy that is actively seeking early entry into new markets globally? Since the establishment in 2007, Scatec has acquired extensive knowledge and experience in developing, building and operating solar, wind and hydro power plants and storage solutions. Driven by our company values and competent global workforce, we aim to deliver competitive and sustainable renewable energy globally; protect our environment and improve quality of life through innovative integration of technology; and create shareholder value. We are present on four continents and are headquartered in Oslo, Norway. Main purpose of position Currently we are looking for a Site Document Controller in Sidi Bouzid, Tunisia to be part of our global team working together towards our vision – Improving our future. As our Project Document Controller you will responsible for the management of all project documents on-site, and follow up on progress of works. Handling intake, scanning, verification, and storing documents.Main Responsibilities Create all document profiles as per the SMDL’s and return the Project document numbers (DocID) to the Contractors  Checking and editing documents for accuracy and compliance  Send documentation on workflow according to the Project distribution matrix and controlling the flow of documents in and out of the department  Generate outgoing transmittals - Return the documents with Acceptance code and comments to the Contractor/Supplier:  Control the receiving and log all Site Daily Diaries in the system  Control the correspondence according to the Quick Guide – Correspondence Register  Manage the External Sharing Site  Provide training to the new project staff at site in the Document Management System  Document status reporting to Project Document Controller and Project Technical Manager Qualifications And Competencies University Degree (education in Business Administration advantageous)  5+ years in Document Control experience, preferably on EPC/Construction Projects  Basic understanding of Engineering / Procurement / Construction / Commissioning documents  Excellent MS Suite software knowledge (EDMS)  Fluent both in French and English written and verbally preferred  Knowledge of ISO9001  Detail oriented, dependable and trustworthy  Ability to communicate clearly in a professional and business manner to various parties  Ability to compile reports and submit to management in a structured and professional manner  Able to work in a fast-paced and deadline driven environment  Ability to prioritize and handle a substantial workload to agreed time schedule  Personal characteristics It is part of every employees’ terms of reference to contribute to Scatec's vision: Improving our Future and adhere to our company values which are: Predictable : demonstrate clear communication and listening skills, shares information in an open and honest way  Driving results: demonstrate determination, pro-activeness, can prioritise and work independently  Changemaker: demonstrate entrepreneurship, can challenge, fast learner, take initiates and adjust  Working together: demonstrate teamwork, shares responsibilities, can compromise, has a can-do attitude  We offer Scatec is an exciting, innovative and ambitious company operating in a growing industry. We offer a challenging and interesting position where you will be part of a flexible, diverse and truly international working environment consisting of highly competent and committed colleagues with a positive drive to make a difference.Scatec is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are made based on merit, competence and business need.Applications will be processed on a continuous basis.

Our client is at the forefront of developing solutions to combat financial crimes, providing essential tools for anti-money laundering and fraud detection. They are in search of a LinkedIn Ads Manager with a strong B2B digital marketing background in the technology sector, ready to manage and expand their digital campaigns, particularly on LinkedIn.Location: Fully-Remote (Work from Home), 9 AM - 5 PM EST or PSTKey Responsibilities:LinkedIn Campaign Management: Lead and optimize LinkedIn advertising campaigns focused on lead generation, lead conversion, and customer acquisition. LinkedIn Ads Strategy: Manage and optimize LinkedIn Ads campaigns, ensuring they align with the broader marketing goals and target the right audience segments. Performance Analysis and A/B Testing: Regularly analyze campaign effectiveness, conduct A/B testing to refine strategies, and ensure optimal performance. Analytics and Reporting: Use advanced analytics to monitor and report on campaign performance, adjusting strategies based on data-driven insights. What Success Looks Like:Lead Generation Efficiency: Your targeted campaigns on LinkedIn Ads have measurably increased lead quality and quantity. Campaign Optimization: Through rigorous A/B testing and analytics, you've refined advertising strategies to maximize ROI. Strategic Contribution: You've successfully integrated reporting insights to enhance the targeting and effectiveness of campaigns. Required Skills and Qualifications:Proven Experience: At least 3-5 years in paid media management with significant B2B technology sector experience. LinkedIn and Google Ads Expertise: Extensive experience in managing and optimizing campaigns on these platforms. Analytical Proficiency: Strong skills in campaign analysis and using A/B testing to improve results. Communication Skills: Excellent communication abilities to effectively collaborate with teams and report on campaign progress. This role offers a dynamic opportunity for a LinkedIn Ads Manager to significantly impact a pioneering company in financial crime prevention technology. If you are results-driven, skilled in digital marketing, and adept at navigating complex campaign landscapes, we invite you to apply and help propel our client's growth in the tech sector.Application Process:To be considered for this role these steps need to be followed:Fill in the application formRecord a video showcasing your skill sets

job_description: Intitulé du poste : Analyste Controle QualiteLieu : MegrineGrading Global : CIVPÀ propos du poste :Vous souhaitez lancer votre carrière dans le secteur des soins de santé de pointe ? Rejoignez Sanofi et bénéficiez d'un encadrement et des conseils de leaders inspirants, tout en contribuant à améliorer la vie d'innombrables personnes dans le monde entier. En tant que stagiaire de contrôle de la qualité, vous consacrerez votre été à acquérir des compétences, de l’expérience et des connaissances précieuses dans notre usine de biofabrication à la pointe de la technologie. C'est une occasion fantastique de se familiariser avec la technologie de nouvelle génération tout en travaillant aux côtés de quelques-uns des meilleurs spécialistes du secteur.À propos de vousDiplômés des écoles Supérieurs avec un niveau d’études techniciens supérieur, licence ou ingénieur en biologie, biotechnologie et ou chimie, un master professionnel souhaitée.Rigoureux et disponible et motivé à travailler en équipes postés.Principales responsabilités :Le technicien de laboratoire est rattaché hiérarchiquement, au responsable direct qui lui attribue les tâches à effectuer en fonction des impératifs du service.Il assure la réalisation des analyses physico-chimiques et microbiologiquesEffectuer les analyses physico-chimiques selon des techniques en vigueur validées, en observant les règles de Bonnes Pratiques de Laboratoire BPL, ainsi que les règles d’hygiène, de santé et de protection de l’environnement (HSE), y afférentes.Responsable des équipements et ou des taches qui lui sont attribuées selon le planning de domaine de responsabilité Doit veiller à l’ordre et à aux rangements des réactifs, de la verrerie et des différents accessoires des appareils du laboratoire ainsi que les déchets des solvantsDoit signaler toute anomalie ou déviation observée lors des manipulationsParticipe à la gestion des stocks des substances de référence, étalons, solvants et réactifs et signaler la nécessité de commande des pièces de rechange, verrerie, colonne et autres consommablesDoit participer à la propreté du laboratoire et Participe à la réception des échantillons pour le contrôle et à la destruction de ces derniersPursue progress, discover extraordinaryBetter is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, ability or gender identity.Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!
